intro: Stachys kermanshahensis, commonly known as Kermanshah betony, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. It produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pale blue or purple in color. Stachys kermanshahensis is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
